results.title: Tokyo industrial worker
results.brief_description: Aside from serving as the nation’s capital, Tokyo is an industrial centre that boasts the manufacture of virtually every conceivable type of product. It also faces such typical urban problems as pollution and overcrowding, as well as its unique and chaotic system of unnumbered streets. This film is about the O-ga family who live in one of Tokyo’s immediate suburbs. It follows the family’s routine on a typical weekday including Mr O-ga motorbiking his way to the small factory where he is employed as a draftsman-technician. Like Mr O-ga, thousands of Japanese are heading for Tokyo and its environs, creating a massive commuter crush. At six o’clock, the work day ends. Mr O-ga returns to his modest home, the evening meal served Japanese-fashion at a low table, and television. Although many western influences are clearly visible in Tokyo, its people have not relinquished their most favoured traditions.

results.title: Tokyo in spring
results.brief_description: A survey of the tourist attractions of Tokyo - the traditional Doll Festival for girls, the tea ceremony and cherry blossom by day and night. Includes types of accommodation for tourists, the public transport system and the spring presentation of the famous Tokyo review.

results.title: Toil and trouble
results.brief_description: When the warehouse boss lowers the overheads, Bronwen fights back and earns a black belt in Industrial Relations. Produced in the style of the silent era, and performed in mime, this short story also contains a social political message of today’s IR laws in Australia. Music soundtrack with English intertitles. Music by Donna Coleman (pianist), Disasteradio and The Raskolnikovs. Warning: contains coarse language.

results.title: Together in the middle of nowhere
results.creator_credit: Rachel Clements, AFTRS and Tony Krawitz
results.brief_description: When his girlfriend decides to do an extra shift at the stripclub where she works, a young man embarks alone on a surreal, drug-fuelled journey. Their separate experiences over the course of the night leave them both shaken, and with their reunion in the morning comes a heightened awareness of how much they mean to one another. Cast includes Mark Priestley and Haley McElhinney.

results.title: Today in Britain
results.creator_credit: James Carr, World Wide Pictures and Peter Hopkinson
results.brief_description: Shows some of the many facets of life in Britain in 1964 and attempts to capture the spirit of the nation. It looks at developments in industry, atomic power, sport and education.

results.title: Today and tomorrow: a story of the Middle East
results.creator_credit: Ralph Bond, World Wide Pictures and Robin Carruthers
results.brief_description: This film deals with the impact of World War II on the precarious economies of the Middle East. It discusses the instability of pre-war Middle East, methods used by the Allies to avert famine during the war, and the desirability of continuing such measures in peacetime. Focuses on Egypt, its people and their lifestyles. Narrated by Valentine Dyall and Colin Wills.
